conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on the metal rod in both scenarios: when the current is I1 and when it is I2.
The metal rod is suspended horizontally by two identical springs and is located in a uniform magnetic field perpendicular to the paper.
When current I1 flows, the magnetic force is upward.
The magnetic force Fmag1 is equal to the weight of the rod mg.
Equation for I1: B I1 L = mg.
When current I2 flows, the magnetic force direction is downward.
The springs support the weight of the rod and the additional downward magnetic force.
Equation for I2: mg + B I2 L = 2kx.
Substitute mg from Step 1 into the equation for I2: B I1 L + B I2 L = 2kx.
Solve for x: x = (B (I1 + I2) L) / (2k).
The elongation of the springs when the current is I2 is x = (B (I1 + I2) L) / (2k).
